title: Library Education Resource Development and Utilization Strategies for Corporate Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A course where science practitioners learn systematic development/utilization of library resources to enhance work efficiency. Requires smartphone-centric access to learning resources in technology-constrained environments

learning_goals: Learners will be able to explain specific procedures for navigating library-based online resources (e-books, databases).
Learners will be able to demonstrate how to design supplementary learning materials (tutorials, webpages) and apply them to workplace support.
Learners will be able to establish strategies for effectively distributing library resources using corporate knowledge-sharing platforms.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
